title: Missing authentication on Notification setting .
vulnerability_information:
Hi ,
Notification setting link works without cookies so an attacker can steal link from browser histroy and can change notification setting of victim.
Notification setting link does not expire even after logout.

Steps to reproduce :-
1.Log in as uber rider.
2.Go to profile.
3.Now go to "Manage your email subscription settings".
4.Copy link of this page and open this link in another browser , it works perfectly.
5.It also works after logout.

activities.message:
Hello, thanks for your report.

While we appreciate your efforts to help keep Uber secure, I'm afraid we don't consider this to pose a security risk to our users as the token in the URL is a very long string of random characters and numbers, that would be practicably impossible to brute force. As such, the only way that an attacker could obtain the token needed for the request is to have direct access to a victim's browser or account. Such scenarios do not qualify for this program because once an attacker has access to a victim's device or account it's considered a 'game over' situation. For this reason, I'm closing this report as Informative.

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
yes , I agree with you that bruteforce of token is impossible.
But depending on a link that never expire even after logout or password change is not a good practice . Attacker can obtain this link from Browser history .
Once a attacker manage to get this link , he get permanent access to victim notification setting.
Here is similar report of different program on hackerone -
https://hackerone.com/reports/109815
